Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark

Class Timer

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer
public class Timer extends Object
Class which is able to time the running of functions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Construct a new Timer and set it running.

  • Constructor Details

    • Timer

      public Timer()
      Construct a new Timer and set it running.

  • Method Details

    • repeat

      public <T> double repeat(int n, Supplier<T> function)
      Run the given function n times, once per "lap" and then return the result of calling meanLapTime(). The clock will be running when the method is invoked and when it is quit.

      This is the simplest form of repeat.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type supplied by function (amy be Void).
      Parameters:
      n - the number of repetitions.
      function - a function which yields a T.
      Returns:
      the average milliseconds per repetition.

    • repeat

      public <T, U> double repeat(int n, Supplier<T> supplier, Function<T,U> function)
      Run the given functions n times, once per "lap" and then return the mean lap time.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type which is supplied by supplier and passed in to function.
      U - the type which is the result of function (may be Void).
      Parameters:
      n - the number of repetitions.
      supplier - a function which supplies a different T value for each repetition.
      function - a function T=>U and which is to be timed.
      Returns:
      the average milliseconds per repetition.

    • repeat

      public <T, U> double repeat(int n, boolean warmup, Supplier<T> supplier, Function<T,U> function, UnaryOperator<T> preFunction, Consumer<U> postFunction)
      Pause (without counting a lap); run the given functions n times while being timed, i.e., once per "lap", and finally return the result of calling meanLapTime().
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type which is supplied by supplier, processed by prefunction (if any), and passed in to function.
      U - the type which is the result of function and the input to postFunction (if any).
      Parameters:
      n - the number of repetitions.
      warmup - true if this is in the warmup phase.
      supplier - a function which supplies a T value.
      function - a function T=>U and which is to be timed.
      preFunction - a function which pre-processes a T value and which precedes the call of function, but which is not timed (may be null). The result of the preFunction, if any, is also a T.
      postFunction - a function which consumes a U and which succeeds the call of function, but which is not timed (may be null).
      Returns:
      the average milliseconds per repetition.

    • stop

      public double stop()
      Stop this Timer and return the mean lap time in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      the average milliseconds used by each lap.
      Throws:
      com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer.TimerException - if this Timer is not running.

    • meanLapTime

      public double meanLapTime()
      Return the mean lap time in milliseconds for this paused timer.
      Returns:
      the average milliseconds used by each lap.
      Throws:
      com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer.TimerException - if this Timer is running.

    • pauseAndLap

      public void pauseAndLap()
      Pause this timer at the end of a "lap" (repetition). The lap counter will be incremented by one.
      Throws:
      com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer.TimerException - if this Timer is not running.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resume this timer to begin a new "lap" (repetition).
      Throws:
      com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer.TimerException - if this Timer is already running.

    • lap

      public void lap()
      Increment the lap counter without pausing. This is the equivalent of calling pause and resume.
      Throws:
      com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer.TimerException - if this Timer is not running.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pause this timer during a "lap" (repetition). The lap counter will remain the same.
      Throws:
      com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.Timer.TimerException - if this Timer is not running.

    • millisecs

      public double millisecs()
      Method to yield the total number of milliseconds elapsed. NOTE: an exception will be thrown if this is called while the timer is running.
      Returns:
      the total number of milliseconds elapsed for this timer.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
